channel.title: Pages on LegitDAO: a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) building the necessary tools to develop an artificial general intelligence (AGI)
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on LegitDAO: a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) building the necessary tools to develop an artificial general intelligence (AGI)

item.title: Changelog
item.description:
Table of Contents
  1. Sathurday, October 19th, 2024

The changelog serves as a comprehensive record of all updates made to the LegitDAO ecosystem. Whenever an individual implements an update, they must create an entry in the changelog to detail the changes they made. These modifications may include alterations to the source code, marketing initiatives carried out on behalf of the DAO, articles written on external websites, or any other contributions aimed at furthering LegitDAO’s mission of developing artificial general intelligence (AGI). This systematic documentation ensures transparency and accountability within the community, allowing everyone to stay informed about the ongoing progress and efforts toward achieving the project’s goals.

item.title: Contact us
item.description: At LegitDAO, we pride ourselves on being a decentralized organization committed to transparency and community engagement. To effectively manage our communications, we elect dedicated individuals responsible for our social media presence and email correspondence. These team members are tasked with posting updates on social networks, responding to community inquiries, and reaching out to individuals across various communication channels.

item.title: Introduction to LegitDAO and Its Mission
item.description:
Table of Contents
  1. Pioneering the Path to General Artificial Intelligence (AGI)
    1. The Vision: Building AGI through Decentralized Collaboration
    2. The Power of Blockchain and DAOs
    3. Infrastructure for Accumulating, Filtering, and Moderating Data

  2. Smart Contracts on the BNB Chain: The Role of Service Providers, Voting, and Affiliate Programs

      2. Real-Time Monitoring and Performance Evaluation

      1. How the Affiliate Program Works
      2. Token Transactions and Tax Fees
    6. Organic Growth and Founding Members
    7. Transferring and Selling Referrals
  3. Building the Infrastructure for Data Filtering and Moderation
    1. The Bytecode Interpreter: Foundation of the System
      1. Why a Bytecode Interpreter?
    2. The Grammar Matcher: Mapping Data to Schemas
      1. Building the Grammar Matcher
        1. The process of grammar matching involves several steps:
    3. Abstract Syntax Trees (ASTs): Structuring the Data
      1. How ASTs Work
      2. Benefits of Using ASTs
    4. The Selector: Extracting Data from the AST
      1. Building the Selector
      2. Use Cases for the Selector
    5. The Grammar Compiler: Converting Schemas and Scripts to Bytecode
      1. How the Grammar Compiler Works
      2. Building Custom Languages
    6. Bringing It All Together
      1. Applications and Use Cases
  4. Graph Database System: Empowering Data Discovery, Filtering, and Connections
    1. Introduction to Graph Databases in LegitDAO’s Infrastructure
    2. Using Grammar Matching for Data Validation
    3. Creating Schemas of Relations
    4. Discovering Routes of Data
    5. Adding Weights to Relationships
    6. Filtering Data and Storing It Permanently
    7. Vectors and Similarity: Building Links Between Data Points
      1. Example 1: Music Recommendation
      2. Example 2: Company Management Analysis
    8. Input, Data Transpilation, and Large Language Models (LLMs)
      1. Data Input and Transpilation
      2. Generating Outputs with LLMs
    9. A Comprehensive Graph Database for AGI Development
  5. Blockchain: Enabling Smart Contracts, Execution, and Cryptocurrency Integration
    1. Creating Smart Contracts with a Custom Blockchain
      1. The Role of the Grammar Matcher in Smart Contracts
    2. Building an AST from Smart Contract Code
      1. Why ASTs are Important
      2. Storing the AST in the Graph Database
    3. Selecting and Compiling Smart Contract Data with the Selector
      1. Compiling the Fetched Data into Bytecode
    4. Executing Smart Contracts on LegitDAO’s Blockchain
      1. Decentralized Execution of Smart Contracts
      2. Storing Execution Results in the Graph Database
    5. Integrating Cryptocurrency into the Blockchain
      1. Transferring Cryptocurrency in the Network
      2. Using Cryptocurrency with Smart Contracts
      3. Facilitating Governance with Cryptocurrency
    6. The Benefits of LegitDAO’s Blockchain Infrastructure
    7. Blockchain as the Engine for Decentralized Innovation
  6. NFT Marketplace: A Decentralized Hub for Programmable Code, Smart Contracts, and Data Processing
    1. The Concept of Functional NFTs
    2. Types of NFTs Available on the LegitDAO Marketplace
      1. Grammar Schema Code NFTs
      2. Selector Schema Code NFTs
      3. Custom Programming Language Schema NFTs
      4. Graph Database Schema Code NFTs
      5. Smart Contract Code NFTs
      6. Vector and Route Processing Result Code NFTs
    3. Creating NFTs: From Code to Bytecode
      1. Code Compilation
      2. Hashing and NFT Creation
    4. Miners and Data Processing in the NFT Marketplace
      1. GPU Mining and Data Processing
      2. Caching Complex Data
    5. Buying, Selling, and Trading NFTs on LegitDAO’s Marketplace
      1. Purchasing NFTs
      2. Selling NFTs
      3. Trading and Reselling NFTs
    6. The Importance of Decentralization in the NFT Marketplace
    7. NFT Marketplace as a Hub for Programmable Infrastructure
  7. Scaling to Real-World Commercial Activity: Integrating Blockchain Interoperability, Enterprises, and Complex Supply Chains
    1. Blockchain Interoperability: Building Bridges Between Networks
      1. Writing a Programming Language for Cross-Chain Communication
      2. Smart Contracts that Depend on Other Blockchains
    2. Founding and Acquiring Enterprises: Integrating Real-World Activity with Decentralized Systems
      1. Managing Enterprise Data Through LegitDAO’s Infrastructure
      2. Building Decentralized Supply Chains
      3. Discovering and Creating Enterprise Networks
    3. Currency and Transactions in the Decentralized Economy
      1. Using Cryptocurrency for Payments and Transactions
      2. Tokenizing Enterprise Assets and Resources
      3. Facilitating Enterprise-to-Enterprise (E2E) Transactions
    4. Real-World Commercial Activity in the LegitDAO Network
      1. Decentralized Marketplaces for Goods and Services
      2. Autonomous Programs and Business Operations
    5. Real-World Enterprises Using Decentralized Technology
    6. Vision for Real-World Commercial Integration
  8. Building Autonomous Programs: The Future of Decentralized Intelligent Systems
    1. The Foundation: Generating Bytecode for Autonomous Program Execution
    2. Analyzing Network Activity
      1. Decision-Making and Goal Setting
    3. Generating Bytecode for Execution
    4. Managing Wallets and Acquiring Services and Products
      1. Managing Cryptocurrency Wallets
    5. Acquiring Products and Services
    6. Physical Integration: Autonomous Programs Controlling Robotics and Drones
      1. Creating and Controlling Autonomous Robots
        1. Real-World Example: A Drone Autonomous Program
    7. Learning and Adaptation: Analyzing Data to Improve Performance
      1. Machine Learning for Continuous Improvement
      2. Feedback Loops for Real-Time Adjustments
    8. Combining Data and Personalizing User Experiences
      1. Data Integration and Analysis
      2. Personalized Experiences and Assistance
    9. Towards a Future of Fully Autonomous Personal Assistants
      1. Autonomous Programs as Personal Assistants
      2. Robots and Drones as Extensions of Autonomous Programs
    10. The Future of Autonomous Programs
  9. Conclusion

Pioneering the Path to General Artificial Intelligence (AGI)

In recent years, advancements in artificial intelligence (AI) have transformed various industries, from healthcare and finance to entertainment and education. However, the concept of a true general artificial intelligence (AGI)—an AI system capable of performing any intellectual task that a human can—remains an ambitious challenge. While AI today is highly specialized and optimized for specific tasks, AGI promises a future where machines can reason, learn, and solve problems across domains without needing domain-specific training. This is where LegitDAO comes into play.

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description:
Commitment to Open Source Collaboration Under the MIT License

LegitDAO operates as an open-source project under the MIT License, which allows contributors to share their code freely while ensuring that any contributions made to the project remain open and accessible. When contributors push a pull request to the LegitDAO GitHub repository, they acknowledge that their code will be released under the same MIT License. This commitment fosters a collaborative environment where developers can contribute their expertise, enhance the project’s functionality, and promote transparency. By adhering to an open-source model, LegitDAO not only encourages innovation but also empowers a diverse community of contributors to participate in the development of the project.

item.title: Propositions
item.description: LegitDAO aims to harness existing open-source projects and develop new tools to create artificial general intelligence (AGI). This ambitious goal invites contributions from anyone interested in shaping the future of technology. To facilitate this, LegitDAO allows individuals to submit proposals that detail their ideas and suggestions. Each proposal is recorded on a blockchain, ensuring that it is immutable and transparent. Once submitted, proposals are put to a vote among LegitDAO token holders, allowing the community to have a direct say in the development process.

item.title: Roadmap
item.description:
Table of Contents
  1. Milestone Deadline
  2. Token Claiming and Smart Contracts
  3. Developing the Bytecode Interpreter
  4. Grammar Matcher and Abstract Syntax Tree (AST)
  5. Virtual Machine Development
  6. Graph Database System
  7. Custom Blockchain
  8. NFT Marketplace Development
  9. Content Database and Language Model
  10. Decentralized Platform for Data Interaction
  11. Clients Onboarding
  12. Conclusion

LegitDAO is embarking on an exciting journey toward creating a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) with a robust ecosystem. Our roadmap outlines the steps we will take to develop essential components that will enable users to claim tokens, utilize smart contracts, and foster community engagement. In this article, we will elaborate on our plans, breaking them down into distinct phases to make our vision clearer and more accessible.
